medical_history.chief_complaint: Fatigue and lesions in the pituitary and cerebellum detected on radiography.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began approximately 9 years earlier with thirst, insomnia, fatigue, and arthralgias. These symptoms had resolved after treatment for diabetes insipidus. However, approximately 3 years prior, insomnia, fatigue, and joint pain recurred, with associated cold intolerance. The patient also experienced a syncopal episode 2 years before the current evaluation. Symptoms worsened over time, with notable recent increases in fatigue, joint pain, and cold intolerance.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes insipidus approximately 9 years ago; previously evaluated for a syncopal episode; symptoms of fatigue, cold intolerance, and joint pain in the past 3 years; treatment with prednisone for suspected sarcoidosis.
medical_history.family_history: Father had diabetes and Alzheimer's disease; mother underwent a thyroidectomy for thyroid disease; an uncle died of a brain tumor; daughter has Touretteâ€™s syndrome; three brothers are healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with wife and child; works in an office; does not smoke; rarely drinks alcohol.
